page.title: 05EAST BANK OF THE RIVER
page.content: MOST OF THE AREA COMPRISED OF MEADOWS, ALLOTMENTS, SMALL WORKYARDS, A FOOTBALL CLUB AND A PARK BORDERING THE RIVER AND BACKING ON TO THE RAILWAY LINE.THE NARROW STRIP OF LAND ON THE SOUTH TIP OF THIS AREA WAS MADE UP OF A BUSY ROAD EDGED WITH TERRACED HOUSES ON ONE SIDE AND ON THE OTHER A SMALL PARK WITH RUN- DOWN WORKSHOPS BORDERING THE RIVER AND RAILWAY LINE. IN THE NORTH THERE ARE A FEW QUIET SUBURBAN STREETS OF WELL CARED FOR, BAY-WINDOWED HOUSES SURROUNDING A SMALL NEAT INDUSTRIAL ESTATE OF LARGE WELL TENDED BUILDINGS. IT WAS VERY QUIET IN THOSE STREETS WITH NO PUBLIC AMENITIES AT ALL. NORTH OF MILL LANE, A LARGE BUSY ROAD LINKING KINGSTHORPE WITH KINGS HEATH, ON THE EAST SIDE OF THE RIVER A NATURE TRAIL IS UNDER CONSTRUCTION. THIS IS A QUIET WALK THROUGH PLEASANT MEADOWS. THERE ARE HOUSES UNDER CONSTRUCTION NEARBY.
